title: How to Delete a Microsoft Account on Xbox

steps.title: Press the Xbox button on the controller.
steps.content: Press the Xbox button on the controller. This opens the menu.

steps.title: Scroll right to "Profile & system."
steps.content: Scroll right to "Profile & system." It's the last icon in the left panel—the one with your profile avatar.

steps.title: Select Settings.
steps.content: Select Settings . It's on the left panel.

steps.title: Select Account.
steps.content: Select Account . It's the second option in the left panel.

steps.title: Select Remove accounts.
steps.content: Select Remove accounts . This is the bottom-right tile in the main panel.

steps.title: Select the account you want to remove.
steps.content: Select the account you want to remove. You'll see some information about removing the account. All save files and game data will still be connected to the deleted account—if you (or the account owner, if it's not your account) signs in elsewhere, they'll still have all of their data.

steps.title: Select Remove to confirm.
steps.content: Select Remove to confirm. The account is now removed from the Xbox. If you sign back into the Xbox with this account, your game info will be restored.

steps.title: Go to the Home screen and press the Xbox button on your controller.
steps.content: Go to the Home screen and press the Xbox button on your controller. This opens the menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll to the System menu.
steps.content: Scroll to the System menu. It's the gear icon on the right side of the left panel.

steps.title: Select Settings on the menu.
steps.content: Select Settings on the menu. This is the first option on the left panel.

steps.title: Select the Account menu.
steps.content: Select the Account menu. It's the second option in the left panel.

steps.title: Select Remove accounts.
steps.content: Select Remove accounts . This tile is at the bottom-right corner of the main panel.

steps.title: Select an account to remove.
steps.content: Select an account to remove. The user's Microsoft account address will appear at the top of the screen, along with information about the type of data that will be removed from your Xbox One. All save files and game data will still be connected to the deleted account—if you (or the account owner, if it's not your account) signs in elsewhere, they'll still have all of their data.

steps.title: Select Remove.
steps.content: Select Remove . The selected account is now removed from the Xbox. If you sign back into the Xbox with this account, your game info will be restored.

steps.title: Open your Settings from the Home screen.
steps.content: Open your Settings from the Home screen. You can do this by pressing the Guide button and choosing Settings .

steps.title: Select System.
steps.content: Select System . You'll see this on the Settings menu.

steps.title: Select Storage.
steps.content: Select Storage . This displays a list of attached storage devices, including external drives.

steps.title: Select All Devices or Hard Drive.
steps.content: Select All Devices or Hard Drive . If you have an external drive connected to your Xbox, choose All Devices . Otherwise, choose Hard Drive . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Profiles.
steps.content: Select Profiles . A list of Microsoft accounts on your Xbox 360 will appear.

steps.title: Select an account and choose Delete.
steps.content: Select an account and choose Delete . You'll see two options for deleting the profile.

steps.title: Choose a deletion option.
steps.content: Choose a deletion option. If you want to delete the account but save the game data, including your achievements, choose Delete Profile Only . If you want to free up the space on your Xbox from the account you're deleting by removing all game data for that account, choose Delete Profile and Items instead.

steps.title: Open the Xbox app on your phone or tablet.
steps.content: Open the Xbox app on your phone or tablet. If you want to stop using a certain Microsoft/Xbox account on your phone or tablet with the Xbox app, you can simply sign out of the app. The account you sign out of will no longer sign in automatically, and you can then sign in with any other account you prefer.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon. It's at the bottom-right corner.

steps.title: Tap the gear icon.
steps.content: Tap the gear icon. You'll see it at the top-right corner.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Sign Out.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Sign Out . This is all the way at the bottom of the page. You'll be signed out automatically and taken to the sign-in page.

steps.title: Open the Xbox app for Windows.
steps.content: Open the Xbox app for Windows. If you want to switch to a different Xbox/Microsoft account in the Xbox app for Windows 10 or Windows 11, you can easily sign out of the app—this allows you to sign in with a different account.

steps.title: Click your profile icon.
steps.content: Click your profile icon. It's in the application bar at the top-right corner of the Xbox app.

steps.title: Click Sign Out.
steps.content: Click Sign Out . This signs out the Microsoft account that was logged in. Now that you've signed out, this account will no longer be signed in automatically. To sign in to a different account, just click the profile icon at the top-right (it's an outline of a person) and click Sign in .

steps.title: Go to https://account.microsoft.com/security in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://account.microsoft.com/security in a web browser. If you left your Microsoft/Xbox Live account signed into a friend's Xbox and want to make sure nobody can use it, you can change your password remotely. [3] X Research source This won't completely remove the account from the Xbox, but nobody will be able to use your account unless they know your new password.

steps.title: Sign in with your Microsoft account.
steps.content: Sign in with your Microsoft account. This is the same user information you use to sign into your Xbox.

steps.title: Click Change my password.
steps.content: Click Change my password . It's the second tile.

steps.title: Create a new password and click Save.
steps.content: Create a new password and click Save . Once you change your Microsoft account password, the new password will be required to use the account anywhere you log in. This means that if someone tries to use your Microsoft account on their Xbox, they'd need to re-enter the password to keep using it.
